titleStmt.title: James A. Dawson et al. to Beriah Magoffin

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
To his Excellency
Beriah Magoffin
Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Your petitioners beg leave to represent unto your Excellency, that at the October Term 1860 of the Hart Equity & Criminal Court a Judgment was rendered against Coleby Shipp in behalf of the commonwealth for one hundred dollars, upon a forfeited Bail Bond of one Richard Murray indicted in said court for assault & Battery
That afterwards towit at the April Term 1861 of said court the case against sa Murray was tried and a verdict returned agset him for the sum of ten Dollars, and judgement entered accordingly

They do not believe that sa Murray failed to attend at the time specified in his said Bail Bond, by the procurement or consent of said Shipp, and as the case was a trivial one and to pay the amount of the Judgment would be a great hardship on said Shipp they therefore respectfully ask its remission

Names
Jas A Dawson
R D Murray
A D Clark
J A Waldeck
Jas. H Compton
R. W Compton
J W Fitzpatrick
W B Brown
